description.narrative: By 2022, in UNICEF supported states, government and partners have enhanced capacity to scale up services for the treatment of severe acute malnutrition, which contributes to Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Business and Key Business Stakeholders demonstrate growing willingness, commitment and resource allocation for protecting and promoting child rights in policy and practice by 2022

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, in UNICEF supported states, government and partners have enhanced capacity to scale up services for the treatment of severe acute malnutrition

description.narrative: With UNICEF support State governments initiate programs for community-based care for children with Severe Acute Malnutrition in nine states; large scale (Gujarat, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh), select districts (Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, West Bengal, Jharkhand, Telangana) or under planning (Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Assam). A strategic approach was developed on strengthening facility-based SAM care focused on under-6 months, structured stimulation and play therapy, maternal nutrition and managing SAM children in paediatric wards. Community based SAM management guidelines are drafted and currently under review. Revised Facility based SAM management guidelines are drafted and awaiting Ministry's finalization and approval. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of children aged 6-59 months with SAM who are admitted for treatment
Number of State have costed action plans and approved budget for facility based SAM (FSAM) programmes
Number of States have costed action plan and approved budget for community based SAM (CMAM) programme
